title: Revelation Chapter 15 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 15 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 15 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 15.

questions.question: What did John see in heaven in Revelation 15:1?
options: Seven angels having the seven last plagues
questions.correctAnswer: Seven angels having the seven last plagues
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:1 states that John saw seven angels having the seven last plagues.

questions.question: In Revelation 15:2, what did those who had victory stand upon?
options: A sea of glass mingled with fire
questions.correctAnswer: A sea of glass mingled with fire
questions.explanation: Verse 2 describes those who got the victory standing on a sea of glass mingled with fire.

questions.question: What instruments did the victorious have in Revelation 15:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Harps of God
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:2 mentions that those who had gotten the victory had the harps of God.

questions.question: Who sings the song mentioned in Revelation 15:3?
options: Those who had victory over the beast
questions.correctAnswer: Those who had victory over the beast
questions.explanation: Verse 3 shows that those who had victory sing the song of Moses and the Lamb.

questions.question: According to Revelation 15:3, how are the works of God described?
questions.correctAnswer: Great and marvellous
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states 'Great and marvellous are thy works, Lord God Almighty.'

questions.question: What reason is given in Revelation 15:4 for all nations worshiping God?
options: Because His judgments are made manifest
Because He created the heavens and the earth
Because He is merciful and kind
questions.correctAnswer: Because His judgments are made manifest
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explains that all nations shall worship because God's judgments are made manifest.

questions.question: What was opened in heaven in Revelation 15:5?
options: The temple of the tabernacle of the testimony
questions.correctAnswer: The temple of the tabernacle of the testimony
questions.explanation: Verse 5 says the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.

questions.question: How were the seven angels described in Revelation 15:6?
options: Clothed in pure and white linen with golden girdles
Wearing crowns of gold and robes of scarlet
Dressed in purple with silver chains
questions.correctAnswer: Clothed in pure and white linen with golden girdles
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes the seven angels as clothed in pure and white linen and girded with golden girdles.

questions.question: Who gave the seven angels the seven golden vials in Revelation 15:7?
questions.correctAnswer: One of the four beasts
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:7 states that one of the four beasts gave the seven angels the seven golden vials.

questions.question: What was the temple filled with according to Revelation 15:8?
options: Smoke from the glory of God and His power
questions.correctAnswer: Smoke from the glory of God and His power
questions.explanation: Verse 8 describes the temple as filled with smoke from the glory of God and His power.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 15:1 says the seven angels have the seven first plagues.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 1 specifies the angels have the seven last plagues, not the first.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 15:4, all nations will come and worship before God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states that all nations shall come and worship before God.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 15:8 says no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues were fulfilled.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 8 declares that no man was able to enter the temple until the seven plagues were fulfilled.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Revelation 15:3: "Great and marvellous are thy _______, Lord God Almighty."
questions.correctAnswer: works
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:3 reads 'Great and marvellous are thy works, Lord God Almighty.'

questions.question: Complete Revelation 15:6: The seven angels were clothed in pure and white linen, and had their breasts girded with ______.
questions.correctAnswer: golden girdles
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes the angels with their breasts girded with golden girdles.

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 15 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 15 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Revelation 15:1, what biblical truth would you share about God's discipline and wrath?
options: God's wrath is purposeful and will be completed in His timing
God's wrath is random and unpredictable
God does not show wrath but ignores sin
God's wrath is only for unbelievers
questions.correctAnswer: God's wrath is purposeful and will be completed in His timing
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:1 shows that the seven last plagues fill up the wrath of God, indicating His discipline is intentional and complete. This teaches believers to trust God's timing and justice (Revelation 15:1, 15:8).

questions.question: How does Revelation 15:2 encourage believers to persevere through spiritual battles and temptation?
options: By showing that victory over the beast brings spiritual reward and worship
By promising earthly riches for perseverance
By guaranteeing no trials will come to those who believe
By urging believers to avoid all conflict
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that victory over the beast brings spiritual reward and worship
questions.explanation: Verse 15:2 describes those who overcame the beast standing on a sea of glass with harps of God, emphasizing victory over trials leads to worship and reward, encouraging perseverance (Revelation 15:2, 15:3).

questions.question: What does Revelation 15:3 teach us about responding to God's works in daily Christian living?
options: We should praise God for His just and true ways with gratitude
We should rely on our own strength rather than God's works
questions.correctAnswer: We should praise God for His just and true ways with gratitude
questions.explanation: The song of Moses and the Lamb in 15:3 praises God's great works and just ways, teaching believers to respond with worship and gratitude in all circumstances (Revelation 15:3, 15:4).

questions.question: A believer struggling to trust God's holiness and judgments asks for encouragement. Based on Revelation 15:4, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God alone is holy and His judgments are manifest, so we should reverence Him
God's judgments are hidden and confusing
Only some nations will worship God
questions.correctAnswer: God alone is holy and His judgments are manifest, so we should reverence Him
questions.explanation: Verse 15:4 emphasizes God's unique holiness and visible judgments, encouraging believers to fear and glorify Him, trusting His righteous governance (Revelation 15:4, 15:3).

questions.question: How does Revelation 15:5-6 illustrate the importance of purity and readiness in Christian service?
options: The seven angels come clothed in pure white linen, symbolizing holiness in service
The angels wear common clothes, showing casual service
The angels are described as unprepared
The angels do not appear in this passage
questions.correctAnswer: The seven angels come clothed in pure white linen, symbolizing holiness in service
questions.explanation: Verses 15:5-6 describe angels clothed in pure white linen with golden girdles, symbolizing purity and readiness, teaching believers to serve God with holiness and integrity (Revelation 15:5, 15:6).

questions.question: A church leader wants to emphasize the seriousness of God's judgment to the congregation. According to Revelation 15:7, how can this be communicated?
options: God's wrath is eternal and sovereign, held in golden vials given by a living God
God's wrath is temporary and uncertain
God has no wrath against sin
questions.correctAnswer: God's wrath is eternal and sovereign, held in golden vials given by a living God
questions.explanation: Verse 15:7 shows one of the four beasts giving seven golden vials full of God's wrath, who lives forever, emphasizing the authority and seriousness of divine judgment (Revelation 15:7, 15:1).

questions.question: Based on Revelation 15:8, what practical lesson can believers learn about God's presence and timing in trials?
options: No one may enter God's presence until His judgments are completed
Believers can control the timing of God's judgments
God's presence is always accessible without reverence
God's judgments have no impact on believers
questions.correctAnswer: No one may enter God's presence until His judgments are completed
questions.explanation: Verse 15:8 reveals the temple filled with smoke of God's glory and power, barring entry until the plagues are fulfilled, teaching reverence and trust in God's perfect timing (Revelation 15:8, 15:1).

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 15 teaches that all nations will ultimately worship God and recognize His holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 15:4 states that all nations shall come and worship before God because His judgments are manifest, confirming universal worship and reverence (Revelation 15:4).

questions.question: True or False: The song of Moses and the Lamb in Revelation 15 expresses doubt about God's justice and power.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 15:3 praises God's great works and just ways, affirming confidence rather than doubt in God's justice and power (Revelation 15:3).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The seven angels in Revelation 15 are described as clothed in ________, symbolizing purity in their divine mission.
questions.correctAnswer: pure and white linen
questions.explanation: Verse 15:6 describes the seven angels as clothed in pure and white linen, symbolizing holiness and purity in service to God (Revelation 15:6).

questions.question: How does Revelation 15:2 inspire believers to worship God amid challenges in their family or work life?
options: By showing that those who overcome spiritual trials worship God with harps
By promising escape from all difficulties
By minimizing the importance of worship
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that those who overcome spiritual trials worship God with harps
questions.explanation: Verse 15:2 shows victors standing on a sea of glass with harps, symbolizing worship after overcoming trials, encouraging believers to trust God and worship despite challenges (Revelation 15:2, 15:3).

questions.question: What lesson about humility and reverence can be drawn from the fact that no one can enter the temple until the seven plagues are fulfilled (Revelation 15:8)?
options: We must respect God's timing and authority, waiting patiently
We can demand answers from God at any time
God's plans are secondary to human desires
questions.correctAnswer: We must respect God's timing and authority, waiting patiently
questions.explanation: Verse 15:8 teaches that God's temple is inaccessible until His judgments are complete, encouraging believers to submit humbly to His sovereign timing and authority (Revelation 15:8).

questions.question: A believer asks about the role of praise and worship in spiritual perseverance. Based on Revelation 15:3, what would you advise?
options: Praise God for His works as an expression of trust and encouragement
Only focus on personal efforts, not worship
questions.correctAnswer: Praise God for His works as an expression of trust and encouragement
questions.explanation: Verse 15:3 shows the victorious singing praises to God, highlighting worship as vital for trusting God and gaining strength in trials (Revelation 15:3, 15:4).

questions.question: What does the description of the seven angels having 'golden girdles' (Revelation 15:6) teach about integrity and readiness in serving God?
options: They are equipped and prepared for their sacred task, modeling integrity
They serve without any special readiness
questions.correctAnswer: They are equipped and prepared for their sacred task, modeling integrity
questions.explanation: Verse 15:6 mentions golden girdles on the angels, symbolizing readiness and honor, teaching believers to serve God with integrity and preparation (Revelation 15:6).

questions.question: How does Revelation 15:7 encourage believers to maintain honesty and trust in God's eternal nature during hardships?
options: By affirming God's eternal life and sovereign control over judgment
By suggesting God is indifferent to human suffering
By implying God is limited in power
By stating God's wrath is temporary
questions.correctAnswer: By affirming God's eternal life and sovereign control over judgment
questions.explanation: Verse 15:7 states God lives forever and controls the wrath, encouraging believers to trust His eternal power and justice even in hardship (Revelation 15:7).

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 15 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 15.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'seven angels having the seven last plagues' in Revelation 15:1 in relation to Old Testament judgment motifs?
options: They symbolize the final completion of God's wrath, echoing the plagues in Egypt
They represent the seven days of creation
They are a new concept unique to Revelation
They refer to the seven churches in Asia
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize the final completion of God's wrath, echoing the plagues in Egypt
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:1 references seven angels with seven last plagues, which alludes to the plagues in Egypt (Exodus 7-12) as a typological foreshadowing of God's final judgment.

questions.question: In Revelation 15:2, the 'sea of glass mingled with fire' is a symbolic image. Which Old Testament imagery does this most closely parallel?
options: The molten sea in Solomon’s temple (1 Kings 7:23-26)
The waters of creation in Genesis 1
The Jordan River during the Israelites' entry into Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: The molten sea in Solomon’s temple (1 Kings 7:23-26)
questions.explanation: The 'sea of glass mingled with fire' in Revelation 15:2 parallels the molten sea described in Solomon’s temple, symbolizing purity and divine presence, linking heavenly worship to the temple imagery of the Old Testament.

questions.question: The song sung by those who had victory over the beast in Revelation 15:3 is identified as the 'song of Moses' and the 'song of the Lamb.' What is the theological significance of combining these two songs?
options: It unites the Old Testament deliverance with the New Testament salvation
It contrasts two different worship styles within Israel
It emphasizes the superiority of the Lamb over Moses
It is a liturgical error in the text
questions.correctAnswer: It unites the Old Testament deliverance with the New Testament salvation
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:3’s reference to both songs links the deliverance of Israel from Egypt (Moses’ song in Exodus 15) with the redemptive work of Christ (the Lamb), showing continuity in God's salvific plan.

questions.question: According to Revelation 15:4, why will all nations come and worship before the Lord?
options: Because His judgments are made manifest
Because He performed miracles for them
Because they fear war and destruction
Because they follow a new religious leader
questions.correctAnswer: Because His judgments are made manifest
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:4 states that all nations will worship because God's judgments are revealed, demonstrating His holiness and justice, reflecting themes of universal acknowledgment of God's sovereignty.

questions.question: What does the opening of the 'temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven' in Revelation 15:5 signify in the literary structure of Revelation?
options: The commencement of the final judgments
The end of worship in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: The commencement of the final judgments
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:5 marks the opening of the heavenly temple, symbolizing the beginning of the execution of God’s wrath through the seven angels, an important structural turning point.

questions.question: In Revelation 15:6, the seven angels are described as clothed in 'pure and white linen' with golden girdles. What does this attire symbolize in the biblical context?
questions.correctAnswer: Purity and priestly authority
questions.explanation: The white linen and golden girdles in Revelation 15:6 symbolize purity and priestly service, reminiscent of the garments worn by priests in the Old Testament (Exodus 28), indicating their role in executing divine judgment.

questions.question: Who gave the seven angels the seven golden vials full of the wrath of God in Revelation 15:7, and what is the significance of this figure?
options: One of the four beasts, representing divine authority and cosmic order
The Lamb, symbolizing sacrifice and redemption
The archangel Michael, symbolizing spiritual warfare
questions.correctAnswer: One of the four beasts, representing divine authority and cosmic order
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:7 identifies one of the four beasts as the one giving the vials, symbolizing God's sovereign authority and the ordering of cosmic judgment, linking to Ezekiel 1's living creatures around God's throne.

questions.question: The temple being filled with smoke from the glory of God in Revelation 15:8 creates a barrier to entry. What Old Testament event does this imagery evoke?
options: The cloud filling Solomon’s temple during its dedication (1 Kings 8:10-11)
The pillar of cloud guiding Israel in the wilderness
The burning bush encounter with Moses
The smoke from Mount Sinai during the giving of the Law
questions.correctAnswer: The cloud filling Solomon’s temple during its dedication (1 Kings 8:10-11)
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:8’s smoke imagery recalls the cloud of God's glory filling Solomon's temple, symbolizing divine presence and holiness that no one can approach, indicating the solemnity of the coming judgments.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 15:2, those who have victory over the beast stand on a sea of glass with harps of God, indicating their role as worshippers in heaven.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:2 clearly describes the victorious standing on the sea of glass and holding harps, signifying their participation in heavenly worship.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Revelation 15:3 describes the song sung by the victors as the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the ____, praising the Lord God Almighty.
questions.correctAnswer: Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:3 identifies the song as that of Moses and the Lamb, emphasizing the unity of Old and New Testament salvation themes.

questions.question: Which thematic element in Revelation 15 reflects the broader biblical theme of God's holiness and justice?
options: The manifestation of God's judgments and worship by all nations
The destruction of the temple in Jerusalem
The establishment of a new covenant with Israel
The defeating of Satan by Michael
questions.correctAnswer: The manifestation of God's judgments and worship by all nations
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:4 emphasizes that all nations will worship because God's judgments are revealed, highlighting His holiness and justice, a theme consistent throughout Scripture.

questions.question: How does the imagery of the temple and the tabernacle in heaven in Revelation 15:5-6 develop the theme of divine presence in apocalyptic literature?
options: It symbolizes God's throne-room and the source of divine authority
It depicts a physical temple to be built on earth
It refers to the earthly tabernacle used by the Israelites
It indicates a separation between God and angels
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's throne-room and the source of divine authority
questions.explanation: The heavenly temple in Revelation 15:5-6 represents God's presence and authority, a common motif in apocalyptic literature emphasizing God's control over cosmic events.

questions.question: What is the literary function of the seven golden vials in Revelation 15:7 within the narrative structure of the book of Revelation?
options: They serve as instruments for the final outpouring of God's wrath
They symbolize the gifts of the Holy Spirit
They represent the seven seals opened earlier
They are awards given to the victorious
questions.correctAnswer: They serve as instruments for the final outpouring of God's wrath
questions.explanation: In Revelation 15:7, the seven golden vials are given to angels to pour out God's wrath, marking the transition to the final judgments in Revelation’s narrative.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 15:8 indicates that no person can enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels are fulfilled, indicating a period of divine judgment and separation.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:8 clearly states that the temple is filled with smoke and no one can enter until the plagues are completed, symbolizing divine holiness and judgment.

questions.question: The description of the seven angels girded with golden girdles in Revelation 15:6 can be linked to which priestly garment in the Old Testament, symbolizing their role in God's service?
options: The priestly sash described in Exodus 28
The ephod worn by the high priest
The hem of the priestly robe
questions.correctAnswer: The priestly sash described in Exodus 28
questions.explanation: The golden girdles in Revelation 15:6 correspond to the priestly sash (Exodus 28), symbolizing the angels’ role as divine agents in executing God's judgment.

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 15 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 15 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the seven angels having the seven last plagues in Revelation 15?
options: They represent the completion of God's wrath
They herald the coming of the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: They represent the completion of God's wrath
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:1 states the seven angels have the seven last plagues because "in them is filled up the wrath of God." This shows the completion of divine judgment. Related passages include Exodus 9 (plagues), Romans 12:19 (God's vengeance), Nahum 1:2 (God's wrath), and Isaiah 13:9 (day of the Lord’s wrath).

questions.question: In Revelation 15:2, what do those standing on the sea of glass represent?
options: Those who overcame the beast and his mark
questions.correctAnswer: Those who overcame the beast and his mark
questions.explanation: Verse 2 describes those "that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark," standing on the sea of glass, symbolizing victorious believers. This echoes Revelation 13:7-8 (overcoming the beast), 1 John 5:4 (victory through faith), and Daniel 7:21 (overcoming enemies).

questions.question: Which songs are sung by those standing on the sea of glass in Revelation 15:3?
options: The song of Moses and the song of the Lamb
The song of David and the song of the Prophets
The song of the Seraphim and the song of the Cherubim
The song of the Patriarchs and the song of the Apostles
questions.correctAnswer: The song of Moses and the song of the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 15:3 states they sing "the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb," which connects Old Testament deliverance with the redemptive work of Christ. This relates to Exodus 15 (Song of Moses), Psalm 149 (praise of the Lamb), and Luke 1:68 (song of redemption).

questions.question: According to Revelation 15:4, why will all nations come and worship before God?
options: Because His judgments are made manifest
Because of His mercy and forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Because His judgments are made manifest
questions.explanation: Verse 4 declares all nations will worship God because "thy judgments are made manifest," highlighting God's just and holy nature. This theme is supported by Psalm 96:10, Romans 14:11, Isaiah 45:23, and Philippians 2:10.

questions.question: What was opened in heaven after the song was sung in Revelation 15:5?
options: The temple of the tabernacle of the testimony
The gates of the New Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The temple of the tabernacle of the testimony
questions.explanation: Verse 5 describes the opening of "the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven," symbolizing access to God's presence and judgment. This relates to Exodus 25:22 (tabernacle as God's dwelling), Hebrews 9:11 (heavenly sanctuary), and Psalm 11:4.

questions.question: How are the seven angels described as they come out of the temple in Revelation 15:6?
options: Clothed in pure and white linen, with golden girdles
Dressed in fiery robes with crowns of thorns
Shining like the sun with wings of angels
questions.correctAnswer: Clothed in pure and white linen, with golden girdles
questions.explanation: Verse 6 depicts the angels "clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles," signifying purity and divine authority. This imagery aligns with Exodus 28:39 (priestly garments), Daniel 10:5 (angelic appearance), and Matthew 28:3.

questions.question: Who gave the seven angels the seven golden vials full of the wrath of God in Revelation 15:7?
questions.correctAnswer: One of the four beasts
questions.explanation: According to verse 7, "one of the four beasts gave unto the seven angels seven golden vials full of the wrath of God," indicating the heavenly order and authority in executing judgment. This connects with Ezekiel 1 (four living creatures), Revelation 4:6-8, and Isaiah 6:2.

questions.question: What filled the temple and prevented anyone from entering in Revelation 15:8?
options: Smoke from the glory of God and His power
questions.correctAnswer: Smoke from the glory of God and His power
questions.explanation: Verse 8 describes the temple being filled with "smoke from the glory of God, and from his power," preventing entry until the plagues are fulfilled, symbolizing God's holiness and judgment. This echoes Exodus 19:18, Psalm 97:2, and Isaiah 6:4.

questions.question: What attribute of God is most emphasized in the description of the seven last plagues in Revelation 15:1?
questions.correctAnswer: His wrath and justice
questions.explanation: The seven last plagues in verse 1 illustrate the fullness of God's wrath, emphasizing His justice against sin. This is consistent with Romans 1:18, Nahum 1:2, Isaiah 61:2, and Psalm 7:11.

questions.question: What theological theme is represented by the 'sea of glass mingled with fire' in Revelation 15:2?
options: The purity and judgment of God
questions.correctAnswer: The purity and judgment of God
questions.explanation: The 'sea of glass mingled with fire' symbolizes God's holiness and the refining judgment of fire, as seen in Exodus 24:10, Ezekiel 1:22, Daniel 7:9, and Hebrews 12:29.

questions.question: Which Christological title is explicitly referenced in Revelation 15:3?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lamb
questions.explanation: Verse 3 refers to "the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb," highlighting Christ's redemptive role as the sacrificial Lamb. Supporting texts include John 1:29, Isaiah 53:7, 1 Peter 1:19, and Revelation 5:6.

questions.question: How does Revelation 15:4 describe God's exclusivity in holiness?
questions.correctAnswer: ‘For thou only art holy’
questions.explanation: Verse 4 affirms God's unique holiness: ‘for thou only art holy,’ emphasizing His transcendence. Similar affirmations appear in Isaiah 6:3, 1 Samuel 2:2, Revelation 4:8, and Leviticus 11:44.

questions.question: What eschatological event is indicated by the opening of the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in Revelation 15:5?
options: The descent of the New Jerusalem
The final gathering of the elect
questions.correctAnswer: The unveiling of God's judgment
questions.explanation: The opening of the heavenly temple in verse 5 signals the forthcoming execution of divine judgment, consistent with Revelation 11:19, Ezekiel 43:2, and Hebrews 9:24.

questions.question: What do the golden girdles worn by the seven angels in Revelation 15:6 symbolize?
questions.correctAnswer: Divine authority and priestly service
questions.explanation: Golden girdles in verse 6 denote authority and priestly function, as seen in Exodus 28:8, 1 Timothy 2:9, and Revelation 1:13, linking the angels' role to sacred service.

questions.question: Why does no one enter the temple until the seven plagues are fulfilled, according to Revelation 15:8?
options: Because the temple is filled with God's glory and power
Because the angels guard the entrance
Because the saints are worshiping outside
questions.correctAnswer: Because the temple is filled with God's glory and power
questions.explanation: Verse 8 explains that the temple is filled with smoke from God's glory and power, barring entry until the plagues are completed, emphasizing God's holiness and judgment (Exodus 33:20, Isaiah 6:4, Psalm 97:2, and Ezekiel 10:18).
